text: Hiley Royal Bamsey (8 October 1916 – 31 December 1943) was an English amateur football centre half who played in the Football League for Exeter City. == Personal life == Bamsey served as a sergeant in the Royal Electrical and Mechanical Engineers during the Second World War and was killed in Iraq on 31 December 1943. He was buried in Khayat Beach War Cemetery, near Haifa. == References == Category:English footballers Category:1916 births Category:1943 deaths Category:Footballers from Devon Category:English Football League players Category:Association football inside forwards Category:Barrow A.F.C. players Category:British military personnel killed in World War II Category:Royal Electrical and Mechanical Engineers soldiers Category:British Army personnel of World War II
title: Hiley Bamsey
